name: Hotel Riu Vallarta

reviews.text: We just got back from the Riu Vallarta. We stayed there between Nov 15-22 with a group of seven. We got to the resort at 130pm and were told we couldn't get into our rooms until 3pm. We brought our 10 month old, and our tour operator talked to the resort as we were driving and got us into our room early. So nice. We were welcomed with a fruit drink as we arrived.
reviews.title: Great Trip!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ROOMS-
reviews.title: Good but not Great

likes.liked: — beautiful location & spaces, friendly staff, great price
likes.disliked: — specialty restaurants, sub-par room service, construction occuring at pool

reviews.text: We stayed in 9040. Best room on that side by far. A junior suite, with one of two large belconies on that side. Amazing view. They rooms were clean and neat every day. Mini bar was stocked every two days. We called on a off day as we had run out of beer and water and they refilled it. The view!! I would request this room. The elevators by the lobby are always slow, so we took the elevators at the end by the adult and kids' pool and took it to floor 8 and walked up to 9. Way quicker!
reviews.title: Had a Great Time

reviews.text: FOOD-
reviews.title: Hard rating this one!

likes.liked: — Ability to use the cheaper resort 2 resorts down

reviews.text: The buffet was good. Lots of choices but no real changes. By the end of the week, got a little boring but still could find something to eat. We ate at all three restaurants- Nivana, Sir George and Tropicana. Nirvana is the japanese themed restaurant. It was good but was a buffet and not plate service. The other two were great. We went twice to Tropicana. Great service at all the restaurants. They had a taco station infront of the buffet daily, highly recommended. As well, most of the nights that had spanish coffee station at the bottom of the stairs. The would light the liquor on fire and pour it into the glasses. So good! For all you Canadians, the lobby bar has clamato for Caesars! YUM YUM!
reviews.title: Wedding Group of 60 people

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I celebrated our 8th anniversary October 18th - 25th at the Riu Vallarta. We, as many others, read the reviews and were concerned about our visit. I will first start by saying that Saturday is not the day to check into this hotel! The lobby was a mad house. The personal service, welcome drink and tour were not a part of our very long check in process. The front desk seemed very disorganized and I won't say that they were rude, but we felt like we were inconveniencing them. The room was as expected. We booked a Jr Suite and it looked just like the pictures. We were in room 7039 overlooking the courtyard with an ocean view. Our only complaint with the room was that the smoke detector flashes red lights constantly. We thought it was just ours and had maintenance up twice to look at it, but after talking with other guests found out that all of them flash. It may not be a problem for heavy sleepers, but my husband does not sleep well anyway and it was very difficult for him to fall back to sleep with the constant flashing.
reviews.title: Good value/Good Service/Decent Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is quite large and noisy. Our last trip was to an adults only resort in Cancun, and we were suprised with the number of children at the resort. We thought that by traveling in October most kids would be in school. They did have a childrens pool and most parents did keep their children in that area. The few who snuck over to our pool were asked to leave by security. Unfortunately there were quite a few parents who thought that they were "off-duty" because they were on vacation and let their children run wild.
reviews.title: Good Riu Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was better than average in my opinion. I thought that the buffet had a nice selection and the food was good. The gourmet specialty restaurant was not our thing as it was mostly seafood, but many people said they enjoyed it. We thought the Steak House was very good. It is located overlooking the beach and you can witness some fantastic sunsets with your dinner. The food was very good for Mexico. The buffet did get a little boring towards the end of the week, but that's to be expected anywhere.
reviews.title: Loved the Riu Vallarta!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are several bars throughout the hotel. We found that the service was good whether you tipped or not. They were very busy the Sat/Sun we arrived and we had to wait a bit for service, but the bartenders were moving as fast as they could to keep up. The drinks were not strong, but they would always make it a double or triple on request. As with all All-Inclusive's they use the "generic" alcohol unless requested. I asked for Smirnoff Vodka the first day and never had to ask again. I didn't notice that they had many waiters/waitresses in the pool area or on the beach. We just went up to the bar if we needed a refill. All of the bartenders (especially at the swim up bar and the courtyard bar) were hilarious!
reviews.title: Finally, the perfect resort

likes.liked: — Great Food, Wonderful Staff and Cleanliness of Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach was nice. There were plenty of loungers and the beach venders didn't seem to bother anyone too much. The water was warm and the beach/sand was not rocky at all.
reviews.title: We liked this place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Bucerias: This is a little town just north of the resort, about a 40 minute walk by beach. Great little town with restaurants, shops and a flea market. I'd recommend going here over PV. We'd walk up and cab back for only $5.
reviews.title: Not impressed...........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Mattress pad: the reviews on the beds are all true. Upon arrival (which was late in the day) we requested a pad for the bed and it was on before we went to bed that night. It made a huge difference.
reviews.title: Do not go in October Mexican Holiday

reviews.text: WOW, I can not say enough things about this resort. For starters, this resort is one of the least sound proof places that I have ever stayed at. The noise level is RIDICULOUS; we almost called down to the front numerous occasions to complain about it, but luckily the volume lowered just before we where going to. The beds, these where the worst beds I have ever slept on and I have stayed at a lot of hotels, they where very hard and the sheets where very cheap quality.
reviews.title: Ok Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I thought kids where going to be in school when we booked this stay, the end of October – beginning of November. Well, I guess everyone takes their little ones out of school and brings them HERE !!!! way to many kids all over the place.
reviews.title: great place

reviews.text: This resort was way to far from downtown. You can take the bus for $3.00 per person each way, to Wal-Mart, then you must get another bus or take a cab the rest of the way to downtown, cab far is about $8.00 and this will take over an hour to do. Cab far for the whole drive is about $25.00. If you like to see the sights, to other things, and take in the culture this resort is way to far away to accommodate these activities.
reviews.title: Earned the 2 star rating!!!

likes.liked: — Room temperature, general cleanliness (except kids pool)

reviews.text: The evening entertainment was adequate at best, I would say a few steps below cruise ship quality and that is being mean to cruise ships. If you stay around the resort, since you are not going into town, do not look for a lot of planned activities, which was disappointing, one day they did have a fun beach band and dancing, but activities where hard to come by, we did kayak and boggy board, that was included at the resort. Plus do not expect service on the beach, you have to get up and get your own drinks!! The nicer restaurants do fill up quickly; I can see how some people get disappointed with that situation.
reviews.title: Riu = no customer service

likes.disliked: — The customer service or lack there of

reviews.text: I always exercise when I go on vacation. The exercise room was a joke!! Way to small, to hot, the equipment was broken and the equipment quality and choices where very poor. The room was always packed which just increased the temperature even more. They did not have an aerobics room with classes which was another disappointment. I always love trying new class in new areas especially foreign countries.
reviews.title: Do not bring your kids!

likes.disliked: — Beds were hard and there were no blankets on the beds just sheets. We called and got blankets
